medical_history.chief_complaint: Mood disorder characterized by recurrent periods of irritability, pressured speech, decreased sleep, tearfulness, agitation, distractibility, and impulsivity, often with concurrent profound depression.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began 3 years prior, with a history of six suicide attempts and eight inpatient admissions. Despite trials of multiple medications, there was no improvement, and irritability increased from antidepressant treatment. Recently, improved mood and decreased symptoms were noted within 2 weeks of adding nefazodone to the treatment regimen.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Bipolar disorder; history of multiple medication trials including fluoxetine, sertraline, paroxetine, lithium carbonate, doxepin, nortriptyline, thioridazine, trazodone, and eight unilateral ECTs.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of psychiatric illness including bipolar disorder in her father and brother, alcohol dependence in her father, and schizophrenia in her mother, brother, and a maternal cousin.
